result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:27 PM Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for LeRoy D. Ferstl.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes requests preliminary hearing be rescheduled.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.

2:42 PM Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for LeRoy D. Ferstl.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests an additional $150 cash bond be imposed.  Atty Getsinger explains missed court appearance due to confusion of court dates and miscommunication to DE from the PD's office.  Atty Getsinger requests previous cash bond be reinstated.  Court reinstates previous cash bond.  Matter reset.
Status hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Body

3:36 PM Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl not in court. Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for LeRoy D. Ferstl.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Det. Kellogg is also present in the courtroom.  Court notes a request was made to have this matter reset and it was to today's date.  Court notes DE signed a bond on 10-6-22 which reflected October 13, 2022, and DE did not appear.  Court notes neither notice was returned.  Atty Hayes has no record to make.  State requests a warrant.   Court notes bond is not to be reinstated without a full understanding of DE's whereabouts.  Court orders bond forfeiture proceedings to commence.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Cover Letter from Atty. Hayes

2:38 PM Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for LeRoy D. Ferstl.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State does not object to previous bond being reinstated but requests an additional $100 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger agrees with the State's request.  Court reinstates previous cash bond and imposes an additional $100.00 CASH bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:39 PM Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for LeRoy D. Ferstl.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hayes is making attempts to get to court.  Court states warrant will stay active.
Body

9:36 AM Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl not in court.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Kellogg appears in court.  Set for preliminary hearing today. DE was given notice for today's date in court.  State requests warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  Begin bond forfeiture.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl in court.  Atty. Hayes needs to be appointed to this case.  Requests preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Absolute Sobriety

2:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LeRoy D. Ferstl appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Markoski. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney. Atty. Markoski advises non appearances - DE wasn't aware of court dates. DE didn't turn self in.  State requests $1000.00 Cash bond. Time limits waived. File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety.
Return date scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
